text: Yuvraj "Raj" Dhesi (born July 19, 1986 in Calgary, Alberta) is an Indian- Canadian professional wrestler. He is best known for working with the WWE under the ring name Jinder Mahal. He is a former WWE Champion, United States Champion and two-time 24/7 Champion. He has also worked on the independent circuit under the ring name Tiger Raj Singh. During his first WWE run from 2010 to 2014, Mahal was known for being part of the stable 3MB (three-man- band) along with Heath Slater and Drew McIntyre. On June 12, 2014, Mahal was released from his WWE contract. However, he returned in August of 2016 looking much stronger than when he left. At WrestleMania 33, he was the last person eliminated from the Andr√© the Giant Memorial Battle Royal which was won by Mojo Rawley. On the April 18, 2017 episode of SmackDown, he won a #1 contender's six-pack challenge for the WWE Championship and at Backlash, he won the title from Randy Orton. This made him the first wrestler with family from India to win the title. On April 19, 2024, Mahal was released by WWE a second time. Dhesi is of Sikh descent. ==Championships== *Prairie Wrestling Alliance **PWA Heavyweight Championship (one time) *Pro Wrestling Illustrated **He was ranked #336 of the top 500 singles wrestlers in the PWI 500 in 2011. *Stampede Wrestling **Stampede Wrestling International Tag Team Championship (two times) (with Gama Singh, Jr.) *WWE **WWE Championship (one time) ** WWE United States Championship (one time) ** WWE 24/7 Championship (two times) ==References== ==Other websites== * * *Jinder Mahal Images Category:1986 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian professional wrestlers Category:Canadian Sikhs Category:Former WWE wrestlers Category:Sportspeople from Calgary
title: Jinder Mahal
